keyEvents.title: CP9 Arrives at Ohara
keyEvents.description: The World Government's CP9 organization arrives on Ohara to arrest the scholars and suppress their research.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of the Ohara Incident, one of the most tragic events in One Piece history.

description: An island in the West Blue known for its archaeologists and the Tree of Knowledge library. Home to scholars who studied the Poneglyphs and the Void Century.
significance: Ohara was the center of archaeological research in the One Piece world, particularly regarding the forbidden Void Century. The island's destruction by the World Government became a defining tragedy in Nico Robin's life.

keyEvents.title: Olvia Arrives at the Tree of Knowledge
keyEvents.description: Nico Olvia arrives at the Tree of Knowledge library to warn the scholars of the impending World Government attack.
keyEvents.significance: Sets in motion the tragic events that will unfold as Olvia reunites with her colleagues.

keyEvents.title: CP9 Ransacks the Library
keyEvents.description: CP9 agents storm through the Tree of Knowledge, ransacking the massive library while the scholars watch in horror.
keyEvents.significance: Symbolizes the World Government's disregard for knowledge and history.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of the Hidden Poneglyph
keyEvents.description: CP9 discovers a hidden basement where the scholars were secretly studying a Poneglyph.
keyEvents.significance: Provides evidence of Ohara's 'crime' and justifies the World Government's extreme actions in their eyes.

description: A gigantic 5,000-year-old tree on Ohara that served as a massive library and hub for archaeologists from around the world. The tree housed countless books and historical documents.
significance: The Tree of Knowledge represented humanity's accumulated wisdom and the pursuit of truth. It contained a hidden basement where scholars studied a Poneglyph, seeking to uncover the secrets of the Void Century.

keyEvents.title: Robin Shares Her Dreams
keyEvents.description: On the shore of Ohara, Robin tells Saul about her dream to become an archaeologist and study the Void Century.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Robin's early motivation and dreams in a peaceful setting that contrasts with the coming tragedy.

keyEvents.title: Saul Learns Robin is Olvia's Daughter
keyEvents.description: On the shore, Saul discovers that Robin is the daughter of Nico Olvia, connecting all the pieces of his journey.
keyEvents.significance: The revelation on this peaceful shore sets up Saul's protective role in the tragedy to come.

description: The coastal area of Ohara where Jaguar D. Saul washed ashore after deserting the Marines. This is where Saul and young Robin became friends.

statusHistory.description: Peaceful shore where Robin and Saul bonded

significance: The shore represents the innocence and friendship between Robin and Saul before the tragedy of the Buster Call. It's where their protective bond was formed.
